greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Prime index of A000101(n), maximal gap upper end prime index.
comment: Conjecture: log a(n) ~ n/2. That is, record prime gaps occur about twice as often as records in an i.i.d. random sequence of comparable length (see arXiv:1709.05508 for a heuristic explanation). - _Alexei Kourbatov_, Jan 18 2019
link: Jens Kruse Andersen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..75
Alex Beveridge, Table giving known values of A000101(n), A005250(n), A107578(n)
Alexei Kourbatov, On the nth record gap between primes in an arithmetic progression, arXiv:1709.05508 [math.NT], 2017; Int. Math. Forum, 13 (2018), 65-78.
Alexei Kourbatov and Marek Wolf, Predicting maximal gaps in sets of primes, arXiv:1901.03785 [math.NT], 2019.
Matt Visser, Verifying the Firoozbakht, Nicholson, and Farhadian conjectures up to the 81st maximal prime gap, arXiv:1904.00499 [math.NT], 2019.
xref: Note that A107578(n) = A005669(n)+1. - _Jens Kruse Andersen_, Oct 19 2010
results.author: Alex Beveridge, Apr 25 2007
ext: Name modified by _John W. Nicholson_, Nov 19 2013
